alert.note: Alert for Avoyelles; Evangeline; Rapides; St. Landry (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 9:57AM CDT by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Rapides, eastern Evangeline, Avoyelles and St. Landry Parishes through 1100 AM CDT... At 956 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Dolorosa to near Big Bend to Cottonport to near Cheneyville. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Opelousas, Ville Platte, Marksville, Bunkie, Simmesport, Krotz Springs, Melville, Moreauville, Cheneyville, Palmetto, Bordelonville, Bayou Current, Morrow, Port Barre, Cottonport, Mansura, Washington, Hessmer, Chataignier and Evergreen. This includes Interstate 49 between mile markers 18 and 62. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
